trans-unit.source: Defines the configuration for a security token service (STS).
Classes that implement STSs derive from the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.SecurityTokenService"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SecurityTokenServiceConfiguration"></xref> class.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SecurityTokenServiceConfiguration.TokenIssuerName%2A> property must be set before the security token service is used to create a token.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SecurityTokenServiceConfiguration"></xref> class.
Optionally loads settings from the current configuration.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SecurityTokenServiceConfiguration.TokenIssuerName%2A> property must be set before the security token service is used to create a token.
`true` to load settings from the configuration file; otherwise `false`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SecurityTokenServiceConfiguration"></xref> class that has the specified issuer name.

If `issuerName` is `null`, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SecurityTokenServiceConfiguration.TokenIssuerName%2A> property must be set before the security token service is used to create a token.
The issuer name.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SecurityTokenServiceConfiguration.TokenIssuerName"></xref> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SecurityTokenServiceConfiguration"></xref> class that has the specified issuer name.
Optionally loads settings from the current configuration.

If `issuerName` is `null`, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SecurityTokenServiceConfiguration.TokenIssuerName%2A> property must be set before the security token service is used to create a token.
The issuer name.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SecurityTokenServiceConfiguration.TokenIssuerName"></xref> property.
`true` to load settings from the configuration file; otherwise `false`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SecurityTokenServiceConfiguration"></xref> class that has the specified issuer name and signing credentials.

If `issuerName` is `null`, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SecurityTokenServiceConfiguration.TokenIssuerName%2A> property must be set before the security token service is used to create a token.
The issuer name.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SecurityTokenServiceConfiguration.TokenIssuerName"></xref> property.
The signing credentials for the STS.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SecurityTokenServiceConfiguration.SigningCredentials"></xref> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SecurityTokenServiceConfiguration"></xref> class that has the specified issuer name and signing credentials.
Optionally loads settings from the current configuration.

If `issuerName` is `null`, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SecurityTokenServiceConfiguration.TokenIssuerName%2A> property must be set before the security token service is used to create a token.
The issuer name.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SecurityTokenServiceConfiguration.TokenIssuerName"></xref> property.
The signing credentials for the STS.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SecurityTokenServiceConfiguration.SigningCredentials"></xref> property.
`true` to load settings from the configuration file; otherwise `false`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SecurityTokenServiceConfiguration"></xref> class that has the specified issuer name and signing credentials.
Settings are loaded from the specified named configuration.

If `issuerName` is `null`, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SecurityTokenServiceConfiguration.TokenIssuerName%2A> property must be set before the security token service is used to create a token.
The issuer name.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SecurityTokenServiceConfiguration.TokenIssuerName"></xref> property.
The signing credentials for the STS.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SecurityTokenServiceConfiguration.SigningCredentials"></xref> property.
The name of the `<identityConfiguration>` element from which the configuration is to be loaded.

Creates an security token service (STS) instance from the <xref href="System.Type"></xref> specified in the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SecurityTokenServiceConfiguration.SecurityTokenService"></xref> property.

The class specified in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SecurityTokenServiceConfiguration.SecurityTokenService%2A> property must implement a constructor that takes a parameter of type <xref:System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SecurityTokenServiceConfiguration>.
An instance of the <xref href="System.Type"></xref> specified in the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SecurityTokenServiceConfiguration.SecurityTokenService"></xref> property.
Gets or sets the default key size limit in bits used check if the KeySize specified in the request is within this limit.
This only applies to the symmetric key case.
The default key size limit, in bits.
The default is 1024.
Gets or sets the default key size in bits used in the issued token.
This only applies to the symmetric key case.
The key size used in the issued token, in bits.
The default is 256.
Gets or sets the default lifetime used in the issued tokens.
The default lifetime to use in issued tokens.
The default is 1 day.
Gets or sets the default token type that is used in token issuance.
The string values are specified in URI format; for example, for the SAML 1.1 token type, the following is the string value: http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/oasis-wss-saml-token-profile-1.1#SAMLV1.1.
The default token type is set to SAML 1.1.
Returns a string that contains the default token type.
The specified value is `null` or empty.
The specified value is not defined in the token handlers.
Gets or sets a value that specifies whether WSDL generation should be enabled for the security token service (STS).
`true` to enable WSDL generation for the STS; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets the maximum token lifetime for issued tokens.
The maximum token lifetime for issued tokens.
The default is 1 day.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Type"></xref> of the security token service (STS).

The class specified in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SecurityTokenServiceConfiguration.SecurityTokenService%2A> property must implement a constructor that takes a parameter of type <xref:System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SecurityTokenServiceConfiguration>.
The type of the security token service.
The type must derive from the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.SecurityTokenService"></xref> class.
The specified value is not assignable as <xref href="System.IdentityModel.SecurityTokenService"></xref>.
The specified value is `null`.
Gets or sets the signing credentials.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SecurityTokenServiceConfiguration.SigningCredentials%2A> property is ignored when implementing an active security token service (STS).
Instead you must set the service certificate through the <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceHostBase.Credentials%2A> property on the service host that is hosting your STS.
The service host used for an active STS is represented by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustServiceHost> class.
The signing credentials.
Gets or sets the issuer name so that it can be set in the issued token.
The issuer name.
An attempt to set the property to `null` or an empty string occurs.
Gets or sets the WS-Trust 1.3 Request (RST) serializer.
The WS-Trust 1.3 Request (RST) serializer.
The specified value is `null`.
Gets or sets the WS-Trust 1.3 Response (RSTR) serializer.
The WS-Trust 1.3 Response (RSTR) serializer.
The specified value is `null`.
Gets or sets the WS-Trust Feb 2005 Request (RST) serializer.
The WS-Trust Feb 2005 Request (RST) serializer.
The specified value is `null`.
Gets or sets the WS-Trust Feb 2005 Response (RSTR) serializer.
The WS-Trust Feb 2005 Response (RSTR) serializer.
The specified value is `null`.
